de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder

Class AbstractMaterialDialogBuilder<DialogType extends MaterialDialog,BuilderType extends AbstractMaterialDialogBuilder<DialogType,?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder.AbstractMaterialDialogBuilder<DialogType,BuilderType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DialogType - The type of the dialog, which is created by the builder
    BuilderType - The type of the builder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractHeaderDialogBuilder

    public abstract class AbstractMaterialDialogBuilder<DialogType extends MaterialDialog,BuilderType extends AbstractMaterialDialogBuilder<DialogType,?>>
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract base class for all builders, which allow to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractMaterialDialogBuilder(Context context)
      Creates a new builder, which allows to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.
      AbstractMaterialDialogBuilder(Context context, int themeResourceId)
      Creates a new builder, which allows to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.

      Creates a dialog with the arguments, which have been supplied to the builder.

      Obtains all relevant attributes from the current theme.

      Returns the builder itself, casted to the generic type BuilderType.

      Sets, whether the dialog, which is created by the builder, should be cancelable, or not.

      Sets the color of the message of the dialog, which is created by the builder.

      Sets the listener, which should be notified, when the dialog, which is created by the builder, is canceled.
      BuilderType setOnDismissListener(DialogInterface.OnDismissListener listener)
      Sets the listener, which should be notified, when the dialog, which is created by the builder, is dismissed for any reason.

      Sets the listener, which should be notified, when the dialog has been shown.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractMaterialDialogBuilder

        public AbstractMaterialDialogBuilder(@NonNull
                                     Context context)
        Creates a new builder, which allows to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

      • AbstractMaterialDialogBuilder

        public AbstractMaterialDialogBuilder(@NonNull
                                     Context context,
                                     @StyleRes
                                     int themeResourceId)
        Creates a new builder, which allows to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid theme

      • onCreateDialog

        protected abstract DialogType onCreateDialog(@NonNull
                                             Context context,
                                             @StyleRes
                                             int themeResourceId)
        The method, which is invoked on subclasses in order to create the dialog, which is configured by the builder.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the dialog, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value
        Returns:
        The dialog, which has been created, as an instance of the generic type DialogType

      • setCancelable

        public final BuilderType setCancelable(boolean cancelable)
        Sets, whether the dialog, which is created by the builder, should be cancelable, or not.
        Parameters:
        cancelable - True, if the dialog, which is created by the builder, should be cancelable, false otherwise
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the generic type BuilderType

      • setOnShowListener

        public BuilderType setOnShowListener(@Nullable
                                     DialogInterface.OnShowListener listener)
        Sets the listener, which should be notified, when the dialog has been shown.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be set, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnShowListener, or null, if no listener should be set

      • setOnCancelListener

        public BuilderType setOnCancelListener(@Nullable
                                       DialogInterface.OnCancelListener listener)
        Sets the listener, which should be notified, when the dialog, which is created by the builder, is canceled. Even in a cancelable dialog, the dialog may be dismissed for reasons other than being canceled or one of the supplied choices being selected. If you are interested in listening for all cases where the dialog is dismissed and not just when it is canceled, see setOnDismissListener.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be set, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, or null, if no listener should be set
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the class BuilderType
        See Also:
        setCancelable(boolean), #setOnDismissListener(android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener)

      • setOnDismissListener

        public final BuilderType setOnDismissListener(@Nullable
                                              DialogInterface.OnDismissListener listener)
        Sets the listener, which should be notified, when the dialog, which is created by the builder, is dismissed for any reason.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be set, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, or null, if no listener should be set
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the generic type BuilderType

      • create

        public final DialogType create()
        Creates a dialog with the arguments, which have been supplied to the builder. Calling this method does not display the dialog.
